roleset.name: to rise, go up, going up (intentional)
roleset.note: ASCEND-V NOTES: Member of Vncls escape-51.1, meander-47.7. (from ascend.01-v)
ASCENDING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from ascending.01-j)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: At least not when you are ascending [*T*-1] .

example.name: both args-- motion
example.text: He ascended the hill, doubtless, because it was more convenient to address the multitude from an eminence than if he were on the same level with them.
example.arg: because it was more convenient to address the multitude from an eminance than if he were on the same level with them

example.name: figurative ascension (probably originally literal)
example.text: He ascended the throne in 1941 after his father, Reza Shah Pahlevi, was suspected of collaboration with the Germans.
example.arg: after his father, Reza Shah Pahlevi, was suspected of collaboration with the Germans

example.name: path shape with GOL and EXT
example.text: The trail ascended 2500 feet to the Kendall Catwalk, a trail blasted out of an alpine knife ridge.
example.arg: to the Kendall Catwalk, a trail blasted out of an alpine knife ridge

example.name: path shape, both args + GOL
example.text: the trail ascended the Bald Hills to Elk Camp.

example.name: Both args
example.text: His ascending of the hill took a lot of hiking.

roleset.name: rise non-intentionally
roleset.note: ASCENDING-N NOTES: comparison to climb.02, rise.01 (from ascending.02-n)

example.name: With end point
example.text: The ascending of her blood pressure to 200 was concerning.
